{{also|schwester|Schwëster}} ==Central Franconian== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|gmw-cfr|Sester|Söster||obsolete}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmw-cfr|goh|swester}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|gem-pro|*swestēr}}, from {{inh|gmw-cfr|ine-pro|*swésōr}}. The native form, at least in western dialects, is {{m|gmw-cfr|Söster}} with ''swe-'' → ''sü-'' (compare {{cog|nl|zuster}}). The modern form is based on {{der|gmw-cfr|de|Schwester}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gmw-cfr|/ˈʃʋɛstʌ/}} ===Noun=== {{head|gmw-cfr|noun|g=f|plural|Schwestere|diminutive|Schwesterche}} # [[sister]] #: {{ux|gmw-cfr|Meng '''Schwester''' es net ens e Johr aaler wie ich.|My '''sister''' is less than a year older than me.}} # [[nun]] # [[nurse]] ---- ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|de|Schw.||abbreviation}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|goh|swester}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*swestēr}}, from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*swésōr}}. Compare {{cog|nds|swester}}, {{cog|nl|zuster}}, {{cog|en|sister}}, {{cog|da|søster}}, {{cog|sv|syster}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈʃvɛstɐ/|[ˈʃʋɛstɐ]}} * {{audio|de|De-Schwester.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|ɛstɐ}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Schwestern|Schwesterchen|dim2=Schwesterlein}} # [[sister]] #: {{ux|de|Meine '''Schwester''' kommt morgen.|t=My '''sister''' is coming tomorrow.}} # {{lb|de|chiefly|colloquial|short for ''{{l|de|Krankenschwester}}''}} [[nurse]]; {{non-gloss definition|by extension used to refer to any medical staff that is not a doctor (usually, but not necessarily, confined to female staff)}} # [[nurse]]; {{non-gloss definition|used as a title of address for nurses}} # {{lb|de|Christianity}} [[sister]]; [[nun]]; {{non-gloss definition|used particularly, but not only, as a title of address}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Kinderschwester}} * {{l|de|Krankenschwester}} * {{l|de|Ordensschwester}} * {{l|de|schwesterlich}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Healthcare occupations]] {{topics|de|Family members|Female}}
